text: |} is a Japanese athlete and sportsman. He is best known as a swimmer who competed in two Summer Olympic Games.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Daichi Suzuki" ; retrieved 2012-8-6. ==Career== Suzuki competed at the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles. He won a gold medal in men's 100m backstroke at the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul. He became a board member of Japan Swimming Federation and the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).World Anti-Doping Agency, Daichi Suzuki ; retrieved 2012-8-6. ==Related pages== * Sports in Japan * Japan at the Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * Daichi Suzuki at DatabaseOlympics.com Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic gold medalists for Japan Category:Japanese swimmers Category:Medalists at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Chiba Prefecture
title: Daichi Suzuki
